name: vscode-deepscan
description: Detect bugs and quality issues in JavaScript, TypeScript, React and Vue.js more precisely
author: DeepScan

deepscan.enable.description: Controls whether DeepScan inspection should be enabled.

deepscan.proxy.description: Configures the proxy. If not set will be taken from the http_proxy environment variable.

deepscan.ignoreConfirmWarning.description: Controls whether you allow transferring your code to the DeepScan server without prompt. Transferred code is completely deleted right after the inspection.

deepscan.ignoreRules.description: Configures the rules to be ignored.

deepscan.ignorePatterns.description: Configures the files to be ignored. (Applied only to 'Inspect Project')

deepscan.fileSuffixes.description: Configures additional suffixes for files to analyze. (Restart required)

deepscan.showDecorators.description: Controls whether the problem of the code should be shown along with the code.

deepscan.serverEmbedded.enable.description: Controls whether DeepScan inspection should be executed via the the embedded server rather than DeepScan server. (Restart required)

deepscan.serverEmbedded.serverJar.description: Configures the JAR file for the embedded server. (Restart required)

deepscan.serverEmbedded.license.description: Configures the license for the embedded analysis.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: cd client && npm run update-vscode && cd .. && npm run compile
scripts.compile: npm run compile:client && npm run compile:server
scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
scripts.install-server: npm run compile:client && npm run compile:server-to-client
